taskbody.context: Use this procedure to update Docker to Docker Community Edition (Docker CE) version .

step.cmd: Remove the Docker repository description file.
step.info: Docker CE uses a different file.

step.cmd: Update the Linux kernel, if necessary.

substep.cmd: Determine which kernel version is installed.
substep.stepresult: If the result is lower than 3.10.0-327.22.2.el7.x86_64, perform the following substeps.

substep.cmd: Update the kernel, and then restart the host.
substep.info: The following commands require internet access or a local mirror of operating system packages.

stepxmp.codeblock: yum makecache fast && yum update -y kernel && reboot

step.cmd: Install the Docker CE repository description file.

stepxmp.codeblock: cat <<EOF > /etc/yum.repos.d/docker-ce.repo [docker-ce-stable] name=Docker CE Stable - \$basearch baseurl=https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/7/\$basearch/stable enabled=1 gpgcheck=1 gpgkey=https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/gpg EOF

step.cmd: Identify the name of the LVM thin pool for Docker.
step.stepresult:
Example result: Pool Name: docker-docker--pool
Record the name for use in a subsequent step.

step.cmd: Back up the Docker environment file.

stepxmp.codeblock: yum clean all && yum makecache fast yum install -y --setopt=obsoletes=0 \ docker-ce-.ce-1.el7.centos \ docker-ce-selinux-.ce-1.el7.centos

substep.cmd: Change the value of the enabled key from 1 to 0.
Save the file, and then close the text editor.
